intro: Diplectria divaricata, commonly known as the variable thorned plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Africa and is characterized by its woody stems and spiny leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a rough, hairy texture. Diplectria divaricata is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent-like leaves.
